oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Color postcard of Esch-Alzette, Luxembourg, sent by Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his father
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox of Dyer, Tennessee, sent this postcard to his father. It depicts an iron and steel plant belonging to Luxembourg's ARBED company. Knox wrote that he was glad to be out of the hospital and back with his company. Knox served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. He arrived in France in September, 1918, and saw action during the final week of the Meuse-Argonne offensive. He remained in Europe until July 1919. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
